oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Embroidered butterfly postcard souvenir
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Embroidered postcards became a cottage industry for French civilians to sell to American and British soldiers throughout World WarI. This example features a butterfly with the upper wings reflecting the American flag and the lower portion the French flag. The butterfly lace opens up to create a pocket where a small card may be inserted. The card included in this example features a spotted dog holding a basket of flowers in his mouth above the phrase "With Kindest Regards."
